title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Broadcom is buying VMware in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $61 billion, marking a big bet that the boom in enterprise software demand will endure.

Accounting firm EY is considering a world-wide split of its audit and advisory businesses amid regulatory scrutiny of potential conflicts of interest in the profession.

McDonald's shareholders voted down two director nominees backed by Icahn as part of his effort to change the way the fast food giant's pork suppliers treat hogs.

The Fed's Brainard told lawmakers that a U.S. central-bank digital currency could one day provide consumers with a level of safety amid a proliferation of privately issued digital assets.

Twitter agreed to new oversight and a $150 million penalty to settle a federal privacy suit.

Old Navy is scaling back an attempt to make women's clothes more inclusive for all body types.

China's Alibaba posted the slowest revenue growth for the second straight quarter since it went public in 2014.

What's News: Business & Finance
